remarks: Properties of a unit vector that we will use later as a convenient reference vector.  This vector is called "e" in the remark after Lemma M of [Crawley] p. 121. line 17.  See also ~ dvhopN and ~ dihpN . (Contributed by NM, 27-Mar-2015.)
statement:
dvheveccl.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
dvheveccl.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
dvheveccl.t $e |- T = ( ( LTrn ` K ) ` W ) $.
dvheveccl.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
dvheveccl.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
dvheveccl.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` U ) $.
dvheveccl.e $e |- E = <. ( _I |` B ) , ( _I |` T ) >. $.
dvheveccl.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
dvheveccl $p |- ( ph -> E e. ( V \ { .0. } ) ) $.
